Pre-Game Insights: Australia demonstrated they weren't about to give up on their campaign with a complete performance against Sri Lanka.

Mitchell Marsh fired after two failures, while Adam Zampa's impressive haul and control through the middle overs marks a point of difference to the Pakistan spin department, who are especially short of form at present.
Australia's failure to keep the opposition openers on a leash two games in a row might be a concern, especially since the Bengaluru pitch is expected to be flat.
Despite playing lots of ODIs over the past eight weeks, the jury remains out on the merits of this Pakistan side.
Pakistan's top three batters are sensational, but their middle order has struggled, losing their last eight wickets for 36 runs against India.
Shadab Khan, Pakistan's generational allrounder, is so woefully out of form that his place in the starting XI isn't guaranteed.
Australia vs Pakistan has historically always mattered in the World Cup, and one of these two teams has never failed to make the final four.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Glenn Maxwell's ability to muscle the ball in the middle and death overs is well known, though - aside from a cameo against Sri Lanka - he hasn't lit up this World Cup.
Babar Azam's recent dry run is ill-timed, as he fell, uncharacteristically, the next ball after reaching his half-century and Pakistan's foundation was shown to have been built on quicksand.
There was a bit of uncertainty about the condition of Adam Zampa's back, but Pat Cummins confirmed he was fully fit.
A viral infection swept through the Pakistan camp over the past week, though almost everyone is on the mend now.
Others: Fakhar Zaman, dropped earlier in the tournament, is unavailable for at least two games due to a knee injury.

Abdullah Shafique, Imam-ul-Haq, Babar Azam (capt), Mohammad Rizwan (wk), Saud Shakeel, Mohammad Nawaz/Shadab Khan, Iftikhar Ahmed, Usama Mir, Hasan Ali, Shaheen Shah Afridi, and Haris Rauf are likely to be in Pakistan's lineup.

Australia's likely lineup includes David Warner, Mitchell Marsh, Steven Smith, Marnus Labuschagne, Josh Inglis (wk), Glenn Maxwell, Marcus Stoinis, Mitchell Starc, Pat Cummins (capt), Adam Zampa, and Josh Hazlewood.
The pitch at the Chinnaswamy Stadium is expected to be flat and the boundaries short, expecting a run-fest, one which rain has no chance of interrupting.
